intro: Pancratium caymanense, commonly known as the Cayman bulb, is a flowering plant native to the Cayman Islands. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has a bulbous root system and produces strap-like leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in coastal environments and is adapted to the warm, humid climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
